meanings.definition: The quality or state of being glazed.
meanings.sent1: The glazinesses of the pottery gave it a shiny look.
meanings.sent2: The artist admired the glazinesses of the finished ceramic vase.
meanings.sent3: The glazinesses of the donut made it look too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with the glazinesses of a fresh morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The glazinesses of the window made the sunlight dance inside the room.

meanings.definition: The act or process of applying a glaze.
meanings.sent1: She learned the glazinesses of pottery making in her art class.
meanings.sent2: The glazinesses of the cake involved carefully brushing on the sugary coating.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret to perfect pastries was mastering the glazinesses.
meanings.sent4: The glazinesses of the painting required multiple layers of varnish.
meanings.sent5: His expertise in the glazinesses of ceramics earned him a prestigious award.

meanings.definition: The appearance or effect of a glazed surface.
meanings.sent1: The glazinesses of the mirror made her reflection crystal clear.
meanings.sent2: The car's glazinesses showed off a flawless paint job.
meanings.sent3: The glazinesses of the ice made it look like a magical crystal.
meanings.sent4: The glazinesses of the lake reflected the colors of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The glazinesses of the floor tiles made the room seem brighter.
